website_summaries.verdict: A classic Timex watch that has stood the test of time. Though not fancy, the design is functional and durable, and has been a favorite by the brand for decades.
pros: A basic yet attractive watch that is easy to read and has a gold-tone stainless-steel expansion band that fits most men
cons: The downside of the unique band is that it has the tendency to pinch on men with larger wrists
The day and date setting is handy, but much harder to set than previous generation models

customer_reviews.title: This watch is accurate for up to 10 years and is virtually indestructible! Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: A great watch for an everyday handyman! Virtually indestructible! This is my forth in 25 years! I never take them off. We live on a Lake and I swim and dive with the watch on! It definitely “takes a lickin’ And keeps on tickin’”! Each watch has worked for 8 to 10 years and thru about 3 battery replacements. The water resistance never fails and I have never had the night light quit in any of the watches. And I use the night light daily after dark and when I wake up in bed. In my opinion (I am 81 years old) there is no better watch, regardless of the money! Buy it! You will be very glad you did!
customer_reviews.author: BLAH

customer_reviews.title: Very nice watch from a reliable brand
customer_reviews.text: Very nice watch from a reliable brand. Well made, size of face is great for those who wear glasses and squint without them at smaller watches, easy to adjust time and date/day. Gives plenty of links to adjust to wrist. This is for my Dad of 87 years. His other watches are Eco's and not keeping time as well. (they need light and motion) I kidded him he should get a watch like his pacemaker, 'takes a licking and keeps on ticking' like Timex. He put his nose up to that. He must have rethought and loves the reliability of this inexpensive gem. SOLD!
customer_reviews.author: Gramma V

customer_reviews.title: Know exactly what you need, and buy accordingly.
customer_reviews.text: The band is too small for my wrist. The last time I bought a watch at a jewelers, he had to remove a band. Two observations: my wrist is not large. This watch did not come from a jeweler. I have many watches, and had a Timex that was perfect. It was an Indigo, the light finally went dark. It did keep time. However, the purpose of the watch was to tell the time without turning on a light. It wakes up my dog. (Not my wife). So if you need a cheap watch that can light up the dial, buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: mike hammer

customer_reviews.title: great watch except when setting date and month
customer_reviews.text: I haver always been happy with the look and comfort of the Timex watch of this type. I have had several of them over the years and this is no exception. Easy to read dial, well lite in the dark when the button is pushed and fits comfortable around the wrist. My only complaint is setting the date and month. The date was not too bad but the month is a pain becuase it needs to be done at a certain time of the day. Since I rarely use the date and month, its no big deal but just an annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: H. A. Kaskoff

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery, bad packaging, all-around bad
customer_reviews.text: I received this watch on Saturday and by Monday morning the battery is dead. The watch was shipped in a thin, torn box in an envelope! I am surprised it wasn't crushed being in such a flimsy package. The included instructions did not instruct how to set the day, date, or time. I know it's a men's watch, as I like a large face and easy read numbers, but it's just too large for my wrist. Not sure I will be able to remove a few links but will try when I take it in for a new battery. Overall, this is a hugely disappointing purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cannot set the Day (m-F).  Can set time and Date only
customer_reviews.text: I am frustrated that I cannot set the Day (Sunday - Saturday). It is stuck on Wednesday. I can set the Date and the time. There were no instructions on how to set it (even though it is pretty standard, I thought that since the standared way of setting it didn't work there might be a special way I don't know about.) If it is broken, then I need a replacement. Plus I was frustrated I did not get the watch delivered on time (a day later than promised). Frustrated Customer Larry J. Arszman
customer_reviews.author: Larry J. Arszman

customer_reviews.title: Good Watch
customer_reviews.text: Okay, it's a Timex, it takes a licking and keeps on ticking! Seriously, the band was too short. And I couldn't find a longer band that was twist O' flex to replace it. You guys need to offer longer bands for larger wrists as an upgrade, or at least sell them in easy measurement readings for replacement. I wound up with a black leather wrist band that doesn't match the gold watch. But I do use it as work watch, but I really wanted the twist O' flex wrist band.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Trammell

customer_reviews.title: Fabtastic Watch!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a Valentines Gift for husband and he loves it. He Had one of those fancy watches that take 2 days to reset when the time changes. This is just what he needed to keep him from having a stroke. Easy to set! Has Fay of the week and Date. Has an awesome light that he can clearly see the time at night. Just what he wanted! He loves it!!!
customer_reviews.author: nagchunn

customer_reviews.title: My favorite watch.
customer_reviews.text: I like this watch a lot due to the large numbers (can read it at night when I don't have my glasses one) and the indiglo technology helps read the time when there is a dark room. The only problem I had with the watch is that the metal expandable band was too small and it kept pinching my wrist. So, I switch it out at Wal-Mart for a longer leather watch band it is much more comfortable. If one's wrist is smaller than mine, the band would probably be fine.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great basic analog watch
customer_reviews.text: My old watch, the exact Timex model as this one, was well over ten years old and, finally, became temperamental (it would run when it felt like it). The crystal was cracked, the plating had eroded off because of sweat and dirt, and ten years ago, it survived a motorcycle crash the put me into the hospital for 63 days. "It took a lickin' and kept on tickin'." (If you remember that commercial, you're a geezer like me!) Anyway, I just bought another Timex just like the old one except the new one is shiny! I expect another ten trouble-free years of service.
customer_reviews.author: RetroDude

customer_reviews.title: Perfect easy to read Analog watch that also shows Military time.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is a favorite because it is easy to read, and has an Analog watch face that includes notations for Military time (24 hour clock). I can read 12/24 hour time simultaneously. No reprogramming or having to change watch faces. I'm happy I found this watch had both time systems in an Analog watch. The night light works great. The day/date lights up better than past Timex watches. The day/date is recessed so it is a little dimmer but still readable for my old eyes. Timex is very reliable in my experience. I am very happy. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: MrData2

customer_reviews.title: Slow timer
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS WATCH. I bought this watch twice. the first one ran consistently slow. So I returned it and Amazon gave me full credit . No problem there. I thought this was a one time glitch and another , similar one would not have this problem. How wrong I was . Ordered a second one - same problem. Runs consistently slow. Not going to return this one simply because I don't have the time even though I know Amazon would give me a credit. Just going to take the loss and resolve NEVER to buy Timex again. Too bad because for years the Timex watches I had were very reliable . I guess all that has changed.
customer_reviews.author: aen

customer_reviews.title: Band only lasted 2 months
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been wearing this style of Timex for every day wear for over 40 years. This is the first time we've had an issue with a Timex. First of all the calendar feature doesn't work correctly. It won't keep the correct day/date. Today for no apparent reason the band broke. We were sitting at the table and it just fell off his wrist. He said he hadn't caught it on anything or done anything that would cause it to break. He's had the watch for 2 months. This isn't an expensive watch but the band should certainly last longer than 2 months. It's pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: dsnrln

customer_reviews.title: Band is too small
customer_reviews.text: My experience with Timex watches has always been great! They keep excellent time and last a very long time. My last one lasted 18 years. It still works, but the band and the watch itself are scarred and rough. So I decided to get another one like it. However, this watch band is too tight and is uncomfortable to wear all day. It pinches! If it had just two more links, I would give it a 5 star. I can't find anybody in Reno, NV who will add links to it.
customer_reviews.author: mrright

customer_reviews.title: Best Watch For The Price Anywhere
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. I've used this same model over the last 20 years. It reminds me of the easy to read railroad watches that railroaders were once required to wear. This is the 3rd one I've owned over all those years and my most previous one still works fine but is looking a little visually worn. I wear mine all the time and do plenty of manual work with it on. So it does take a beating and keeps on ticking. The built in light is great feature and my little granddaughter loves to light it up every time she comes around. I highly recommend this watch!
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Functional and Fairly Rugged, But ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used these watches for years. They keep great time and the lighted feature is very nice if I'm sleeping where I can't see a clock. I've had to buy replacements about every four years, usually because the expansion band breaks. I don't think that's a negative because I wear the watch when I'm doing work that gets a lot of grit in the band. Update after 9 months: The band on this one just broke. That is awfully quick and makes the watch useless because these bands can't be replaced. I decided to try a model that has a different band.
customer_reviews.author: W. McTeer

customer_reviews.title: So close! Yet so far.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I have to say this watch looks great. I love the face; the expansion band is simple and comfortable; I chose this specific model specifically for the day and date windows. So just fine all the basics. I'll live with it just fine. Issues: the indiglo doesn't light up the whole face, there's a blank spot at the top. It doesn't obscure the watch face, but it just seems unnecessary and easily fixable. This watch is also annoying to adjust. To change the day, you have to spin the minute and hour hand all the way through the week. The date, however, is independently adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: al

customer_reviews.title: Could’ve been better
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying Timex watches for years and have never had a problem. I bought this watch because it looked easy to read, and it is, although the date could be bigger. Indiglow feature works great. My 2 issues are 1) I can not advance the day of the week(M-Sun) 2) The band came with defects, almost like it wasn’t formed correctly on some links which made the ends very sharp. I had to use pliers to bend the points back. I use this as work watch, so these problems didn’t warrant me returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Thatsjusme

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this watch.
customer_reviews.text: The watch looks good but loses time daily. I sent it back and paid ahead for the $8 shipping as they requested I do. They received it and sent me a message telling me they will let me know in a few weeks what is wrong with it and how much it will cost me for them to fix it. What! It's a $40 watch! They should have sent a new one since this one is obviously defective. I should have trashed it and got a different brand. I would not recommend purchasing this watch or any Timex watch since this is how they do business.
customer_reviews.author: Mc

customer_reviews.title: its a timex!
customer_reviews.text: what can I say,its a Timex,its just what I expected ,keeps good time, is very durable, you don't have to baby it, so what else do you want? My last Timex had a black face on it but this time I picked the white face and to me is better to read. My old Timex I was replacing not because it wasn't working because it still was, but the dial was so scratch up that it was hard to read and the battery was getting weak as the light was real dim so time for a new one!
customer_reviews.author: g b

customer_reviews.title: Dad approved :)
customer_reviews.text: I got my dad one of these years ago. He loved it. He got very sick and during one of his many hospital visits/stays it got lost. He must've said 20 times how much it upset him because he liked it so much. So, I got him another one and it stayed on his wrist right up until the day he passed away. Now, it's mine and I love it too. It was my dad's watch so, that's part of it. But, it is also a quality, strong and sharp looking time piece. I can see why he liked it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Mjolner

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hey it's a Timex not a Rolex. I have had 3 Timex watches like this over the last 15 or 20 years. I have played golf, worked in the yard, gotten it wet, and banged the hell out of it ......they keep on working. Eventually, after years, the light fails to light in the dark---then I toss it. I like the easy to read face and calendar function. I have had this one for about a month and works great----keeps accurate time and feels and looks great. If you want a watch that you don't have to baby and functions great this is it .....buy it dummy....what have you got to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Z Man

customer_reviews.title: keeps time, backlight is great
customer_reviews.text: keeps time great, waterproof, I shower with it everyday. Back light is great in the middle of the night, easy to read. My only bitch would be setting the date and day, date is easy, day not so much. I think to set the day you have to just keep running the time forward until you get to the correct day, then set the date. I bought this watch just to swim and play in and not wear my "good" watch...I will buy again if this one stops
customer_reviews.author: beach guy

customer_reviews.title: Good watch for seniors
customer_reviews.text: So, as I've retired, I was looking for a watch that had both the day and date easily readable. Since I no longer work, the days get lost in my world...LOL... This watch is easy to read, waterproof (as I've worn it in the shower and washing the cars), and durable. The expansion band seems to fit my wrist (7.5" circumference) just right, as it's not too tight or loose. Looking forward to many years of service from it.
customer_reviews.author: KEW824

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few months of light use
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this watch for my children to use for timed exams and it stopped working 5 months later. Just dead (not battery issue). This happened to me with the last Timex too. The one before that I had forever. What is going on?
customer_reviews.author: Need More Seltzer

customer_reviews.title: I have three of these because I love the size(not too big) and they are easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these because I love the size(not too big) and they are easy to see in the shower without glasses. I ordered a spare in case they stop making them, and also like the fact that all three of them keep time with the atomic clock for months on end and the expansion band is great
customer_reviews.author: brian schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Great watch other than tight band
customer_reviews.text: I really like my new Timex watch. It's just like an old one I used to wear 20 years ago. The only thing I don't like is the band is too tight, and Timex makes it a real pain to get a larger band as they don't sell links. Years ago every flex band watch I owned came with a band that was too large and needed links removed. Now the Timex watches come with bands that are too small. And I don't have giant wrists!
customer_reviews.author: Rumely

customer_reviews.title: Top notch watch for lots less bucks
customer_reviews.text: Watches must generate HUGE profits as you see a new watch almost every 5 seconds. Most are always vastly expensive, and makes one think you need to win the Lottery to actually own one. This superior TIMEX watch at just $35 is smart looking, keeps excellent time, rainproof, lights up if needed, and it looks much more expensive than it is. Why spend a fortune, if you can get this winner for just $35. I absolutely love it and I'm so happy I decided to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: John Clayton

customer_reviews.title: I REALLY LIKED THE WATCH, WHILE IT LASTED
customer_reviews.text: I HAD THE WATCH FOR ABOUT A YEAR, THEN IT QUIT, TRIED TWO PLACES TO GET THE BATTERY REPLACED, IT APPEARS IT CAN'T BE DONE. A BIG WASTE OF MONEY FOR ONLY A YEAR. WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND ANYONE TO EVER BUY A TIMEX. IT APEARS IT IS NOT THE COMPANY IT USED TO BE.
customer_reviews.author: MYRTLE ROBBINS

customer_reviews.title: Great watch...SO FAR???
customer_reviews.text: I needed a watch that was backlit and had date and time. That left Timex as my only choice. This watch is great SO FAR but I just threw my last “same as this” Timex away as it randomly stopped and started and it wasn’t the battery. Timex quality is not what it used to be. On the watch 2 watches back the chrome finish deteriorated and the rough edges cut my wrist. I’m giving it 4 stars because it does exactly what I want. Hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Don S

customer_reviews.title: Hard to set
customer_reviews.text: As a watch to tell time it appears to be quite good although after months I will have a better idea as to just how accurate it will be. I have two problems with the watch; setting day/date is very difficult as the mid positions of the stem are much too hard to locate and the band does not appear to be adjustable -- it is a little too long for my wrist. Neither of these is negative enough to justify replacement as the face is more readable than most.
customer_reviews.author: Salem Spitz

customer_reviews.title: Good watch
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast. Standard Timex quality which is good. Band is too small. Biggest downside for me is I can’t change the day feature. Everything else is fine. Just can’t change the day. Tried to contact customer service with no success. This watch model number doesn’t even show up on timex’s Website. That tells me this model is old enough they won’t support it any longer. Would recommend a newer model or spend a few more bucks for a better brand
customer_reviews.author: heffymac

customer_reviews.title: It's great
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a fan of these kinds of watches but I have to get one for my career (CNA). I like it because of its crisp and clear readings as well as the date right in front. The next selling point was the extending wrist. Handwashing is something i'll be doing pretty much every 30 minutes now and I need to be able to wash my wrist. With the extendable band I can easily slide the watch up instead of unbuckling it.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Whoops!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is perfectly what I wanted--good quality, attractive, practical. Hey, after all, it's a Timex! Unfortunately this watch had been a store-display item, and the watch arrived with a dying battery. The seller was good enough to refund my expense without a problem. That's very commendable in my book, so thanks, Seller! I would have no problem with using your services again.
customer_reviews.author: Incognito

customer_reviews.title: Tuff, nice looking work watch!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is growing on me. I thought at first it was kind of small next to my G- shocks. But it has a good looking dail and it is tuff! I've been hammering with this, sawing, getting it wet, and banging it a lot. It still keeps perfect time. It's very easy to read, and has a great backlight; that lights up the whole dial, day and date too! This has become my go to watch. I'm liking it's old fashioned, manly look. It looks like the old reliable railroad wrist watches that my Dad used to wear. He would be proud that I'm wearing this!
customer_reviews.author: J. T.

customer_reviews.title: it stopped working in 30 days POS
customer_reviews.text: What a great watch I can't say enough positive things to say night lite is perfect only beef are directions on how to set allow me to clarify the stem has multiple positions but detent is so light it very difficult to confirm out 2 or out 3 1= all the way in 2 set day & time then it only advances you need to go forward I ended up calling Timex customer service in Philippines white girl perfect English and she knew exactly how to resolve your setting issue
customer_reviews.author: bill Leland

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues
customer_reviews.text: I like the general layout of the watch. This is the second Timex I've purchased from Amazon in the past few months. The band on the first one failed. The next one, the winding stem would not engage the "Day of the Week" feature. Time and "Day of the Month" adjustments OK. Thought about sending it back. Decided to just turn off the watch and let the actual day catch up to the watch display. Only need to adjust day if the watch battery runs down and is replaced. Used Timex's for years, but it seems they have developed quality issues.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Monk

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is the model I buy over and over again. It truly takes a kicking and keeps on ticking. That is, Until you need a new battery and the jeweler can't get the back to reseat properly. I've found the night time illumination priceless during my late night ninja activities as I document my girlfriend cheating on me at all hours of the night while I sit in the dark outside her window watching......waiting. I've purchased less expensive watches, I've purchased much more expensive watches, and this by far is the best value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth wilson

customer_reviews.title: It takes a licking but keeps on ticking.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these Timex watches with the light in them,they have lasted for many years. This probably is my 3rd one over 25 years. They are not that expensive and they take a lot of abuse. As a soil test driller working in the mud and water my watches do take a lot of abuse. The large numbers are easy too see and waking in the middle of the night it is easy to see the dial.
customer_reviews.author: Roy B.

customer_reviews.title: Very good watch for nurses or people who lose watches
customer_reviews.text: Very nice not expensive watch .Great for nurses or people who wash their hands often.If it gets lost it's not a huge loss. The dial also has military time. I am big jointed so it's a little on the tight side but average men or women who wear it should fit fine. It's also a great first time watch for a young person .HEY ITS A TIMEX IT TAKES A LICKIN BUT KEEPS ON TICKIN.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect inexpensive watch
customer_reviews.text: Best thing I like is the small 24 hour numbers; I have clients that use 24-hour time and the watch has the 24 hour numbers in red above the larger black numbers. My other watches are rather thick; this watch is pretty thin so great when wearing long sleeve dress shirts. The light at night is a plus. Did I mention it keeps flawless time? Yep...flawless.
customer_reviews.author: MWG2

customer_reviews.title: a great watch - inexpensive, easy to read, accurate and lights up when you push the crown
customer_reviews.text: This watch is not really for the style conscious, but it is accurate, indicates day and date, lights up when you push on the crown and is comfortable to wear. I only break out my late uncle's Rolex when I dress up. The Rolex costs $200 to clean every year, isn't always that accurate and I am always fearful of taking it off and leaving it somewhere; at $35.00 I am not so fearful.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Deshane

customer_reviews.title: Difficult/ Impossible to Adjust
customer_reviews.text: Plan to return. Can not get day and date to function; that is adjust to correct day and date. Already have same watch. Same problem; that is to do adjustment. Was able to do with difficulty. As a time piece it is good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to wear and easy to see
customer_reviews.text: Very nice watch that's easy to wear and easy to see. The expansion band is perfect for my thin wrist. If you have thick wrists, this band may not work for you. As I get older, the ease of reading has become more of a requirement. This watch deliver's on that as well as being good looking. Though I don't need it very often, the night lighting is very effective.
customer_reviews.author: Yar Mosnar

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking watch, with all the features I need at a low price!
customer_reviews.text: My kind of watch, you take it out of the box and in a few minutes it is all set up and on your wrist. I am old fashion and I like the expandable watchbands. I think this would fit a wide variety of wrists. Not a phony looking cheap watch that is made to look like a rolex. It was made to look like a Timex and that is what it is. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Cattleman's

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch! Use it at work as a nurse. The face is easy to read. The flexible band makes it easy to put on and remove. I fall asleep with the watch on my arm. It is convenient to tell time with its lighted face. I would buy this watch again in a heartbeat. It is difficult to find another watch with these features!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good watch for the visually challenged
customer_reviews.text: This watch seems to be a sturdy and comfortable timepiece. It is plain but nice looking. The hands and numbers are very large and easy to read. The band seems sturdy as well. The day/date feature is small and barely readable without my glasses. The only know I would give the watch is the lack of clear instructions for setup. However, It was not too difficult. Assuming the watch works in the long-term, I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: LinKen

customer_reviews.title: Very good basic watch
customer_reviews.text: Very good basic watch. I only gave it 4 stars because the flex ban was to small. I have average size wrists so it should of fit. I am keeping the watch as timex watches last a long time, I took my band off my old timex and put on my new one. My last timex band was to big and had to remove links so I don't know what the issue is with not putting a medium band on. Overall, I'm happy with timex watches.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: It's just a Timex.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read dial compared to LED numbers, calendar and time are also easy to set. Wrist band is a step up from leather or rubber. Good watch for the price.
customer_reviews.author: R. Monte

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to set
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning this watch even though it had all the features I wanted. No instructions so had to go to website. Trying to follow directions, I found there was no way to pull out the crown, which is very small, just using my fingers. Resorted to using a box cutter into tiny space just to pull it out enough to set the time. Had to use a plyers to pull it out far enough to set date and day, whole stem came out several times. After a half hour or so, I managed to set everything, but had to spin crown through 24 hours to advance day. So disappointed as the rest of the watch was perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: rosybee

customer_reviews.title: Timex Watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. I like the fact that it dispays the day and date. I also love the gold color. The only negative is that the band fits a little to snug at first-but then it stretches out to feel better after wearing it a few weeks. I am satisfied with all of my Timex Watches and would recommend purchasing one.
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie Capodice

customer_reviews.title: I followed instructions on other watch I bought (pocket watch) Otherwise a good Timex, and time will tell if it’s a ...
customer_reviews.text: No real instructions on how to set the day of week, no it’s not intuitive as watches are different. I followed instructions on other watch I bought (pocket watch) Otherwise a good Timex, and time will tell if it’s a good watch or not. It’s for work, I am a nurse so it was about a big clear easy to read face, and it has that. Update: It has stopped a couple of times in the last month or so. I can correct it, but that’s not the point. Not very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Serious Buyers Remorse - Day/Date/Time Feature Sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the husband. I'd rather have teeth pulled than try to adjust the day, date, and time on this watch. What a royal pain in the a$$! The Timex website was no help, nor was their Customer Service rep in India. Serious buyers remorse on this one!
customer_reviews.author: doormold

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to read.
customer_reviews.text: Great watch. I can't see why anyone needs an instruction manual for this watch, even though one is included. Granted the font size is teeeeeny. It is ironic that a watch that touts the ease with which it can be read is furnished with an instruction sheet that requires an electron microscope. It is a good value as long as the battery life is as long as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Motorman66

customer_reviews.title: I'm also glad this had an adjustable wrist so it wasn't necessary ...
customer_reviews.text: Gift to my elderly father who has problems seeing small things. The numbers on this watch works well and big enough for him to see. Also helpful is that this has the option of a glow light to see at night. I'm also glad this had an adjustable wrist so it wasn't necessary for me to go to the jewelers to have links removed. My father and I are happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MVB

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I received this watch as a replacement for the first one that got sent to me with a dead battery and faulty date and day part of the watch. The watch I received as a replacement was very dirty and all scratched up-not even close to the same condition as the first watch. I thought it was going to arrive in similar condition. I’m very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for a family member. He really loves it. I took the initiative to set the time and date. I found it a bit cumbersome to get it all aligned properly in order to do so. But once I finally figured it out it is working out very well. The Indiglo light feature is very nice and makes it easy to see the time in the dark. It's a very handsome looking watch.
customer_reviews.author: ABC_Easy_As_123

customer_reviews.title: Looks great! Easy to read, and dad loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Time for Dad to get a new watch, so we chose a reliable brand, great looks, contrast, easy read, and dad enjoyed the date and day of the week as a bonus to what he had before! He was really happy to have such a nice watch! He's 90, he's been through a few watches. He really liked this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon fan

customer_reviews.title: A little small in the band
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother even though it is a men's watch. She likes the elastic type band so I figured a Men's watch would leave her plenty of room. It was still a bit tight. Other than the band being too small it is great. Can't find a replacement band that says it is "large" and is also the stretchy one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A BIG HIT ... smiling ear-to-ear
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this watch. He had this same watch for more than 8 years ago it was time to be replaced. I was on the hunt for this EXACT watch and of course amazon had what needed. My husband was so happy to see this same watch under the tree for him. He's smiling ear-to-ear! Totally worth the money spent, the quality great and name brand is timeless!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hailey

customer_reviews.title: Practical quality for low cost
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for me. Easy to see big, bold numbers, tells me date, time and day with a glance, even in the dark with the little light. High quality for low cost. Sure, my wife's smart watch can show her text messages and heart rate but she paid 10 times as much. For that I'll look at my phone, take my pulse with my new Timex. The band isn't exactly identical to original 'Twist-o-Flex' (not quite as twisty) but it's essentially the same thing. This watch looks great and it's flawless.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read day & date Timex - can’t beat it
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Indigo watch (I’ve worn out the last 2 after many years wear). I like this one because of the day & date feature. Also, It’s really easy to read as the numbers are on the larger size and very clear. The dark blue background really lets the numbers pop.
customer_reviews.author: JQ

customer_reviews.title: A watch
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read, easy to set. I really like the day/date feature. The backlight works but doesn't cover the entire face. There's a little sliver it doesn't light but it does not affect readability in dark at all. The metal on the watch will get very light scratches, purely cosmetic and doesn't bother me. Had it a couple months and have had to adjust the time other that setting the date which is normal for this type of watch. Good price, good watch.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Guy

customer_reviews.title: I have just received a TimexT20461JT, it has problems
customer_reviews.text: The watch has date and day display, but it is impossible to actually set them. I read all of the instructions on the three position setting knob. The time works perfectly but the date and day will absolutely not move. The expansion band is far too tight for an adult male. The instruction sheet in many different languages does not even tell you about the three position knob!
customer_reviews.author: rrbv

customer_reviews.title: Only one minor problem
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Big enough for me to read! Only dislike is the band is tight And I’m a small lady! How’s this on a man’s wrist? I couldn’t figure out a way to drop a star because of the band so gentlemen, beware. Keeps really good time! And I like the date feature.
customer_reviews.author: HODGEPODGESPVTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: awesome watch for the price-great flexiband
customer_reviews.text: my son loves this watch. He uses it for nursing. The flex band is perfect for him. Has the second hand for him to take pulse. One issue we had, was when we first purchased it, he opened the box, because it was a gift and the second hand was not working. Amazon replaced it free for me. The second one came and the battery stopped working within one week of purchasing it. Replaced the battery and havent had an issue since. He wears it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Ellis

customer_reviews.title: A good-looking, simple, reliable timepiece
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman who prefers men's watches so that I can clearly see the time and date. This one, with the black numbers against a white face, is easy to read at a glance. Since I'm retired, having the day of the week featured is helpful, too. The band is extremely comfortable - no pinching or snagging and it fits my small wrist once my jeweler removed several links. Since it's a Timex, I know I can count on it to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: A Hot Mess

customer_reviews.title: Takes a Lickin’!  A Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: A great watch for a large handed man with old, tired eyes. Very comfortable band. No problems with it while submerged doing dishes, though I wouldn’t swim with it for any length of time. The day/date is a bit small and tough see and decipher, but I still have my memory so I can usually remember. The light can be obscured a bit depending on the position of the hands. The chrome/blue face received a few compliments.
customer_reviews.author: PinkieWasHere

customer_reviews.title: is painstakingly tedious.
customer_reviews.text: Just remember, this watch is analog and "stupid" and doesn't know how many days are in each month, so you'll be re-setting it on a regular basis. Also, setting the time, date, and day, with a single knob, is painstakingly tedious.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Have used for years...
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch (am now on my third or fourth in 30 plus years)... the ONLY reason I went with four stars is that I wish Timex would offer it with a larger band (wrist is about 8.5 inch circumference) instead of having to find a place to add links to the existing band. Otherwise - it's everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: Pastor G

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit, even for larger wrists
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my dad. He is very pleased with the look and fit, and says that the light is very bright and a useful function. Looking forward to the benefits of water resistance, but can't comment on that quality yet cause it is still new to us.
customer_reviews.author: LYNDA OSWALD

customer_reviews.title: Defective,  can not change the day.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is identical to one I have worn for 15 years, so I can tell you that it is defective. It was two days behind. I actually had to turn the watch off and put it aside for 5 days until the day came around again, then turn it back on , and use it. It is now correct.
customer_reviews.author: John Bernardon

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and value, year after year.  Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: My third such watch, all identical, in perhaps 30 years. Always reliable, always readable even at night, and the expansion band fits my particular wrist size without modification. The day and date could be a bit more readable, but perhaps not at this cost. The Rolex I once got a relative had a little magnifying glass built into the lens but otherwise performed no better. Superior quality for the price and excellent time keeping at any price point.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin McConoughey

customer_reviews.title: It's a great watch, accurate and reliable with the sweep second ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a great watch, accurate and reliable with the sweep second hand technology, this time Timex is a digital watch that lights up with the press of a button and it's waterproof. It tells you day and date and the wristband fits perfect, no sliding up and down my wrist.. Personally I could never understand the hype with Apple watches for the amount of money they're asking. For $25, Timex will give you a far superior product that can last you a decade before you ever need to change the battery and you never have to charge it..!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Beeler

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Watch!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is definitely easy to read and I really like the indiglo backlight. Good band replacements are: 1) Timex IQ+ move 18mm silver stainless steel mesh bracelet and 2) Fullmosa stainless steel silver band (LWS-0778). The Fullmosa band was thinner, more comfortable and less expensive than the Timex for my small wrists.
customer_reviews.author: smylins

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as Gift
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two Timex T20031 as gifts for my brothers and they were truly well received. These watches look like it is worth a lot more than what I have paid for them on Amazon. They are a dressier watch than the plain white background. The Indigo lights is always an extra with a watch. I purchased a Timex 3 years ago and continuously use the Indigo light at night and I have never had to replace the battery in those 3 years plus. The battery in these are guaranteed for 10 years. All in all this watch is well worth the price you pay for. They were quickly received when ordered online through Amazon. No regrets whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Levis Ouellet

customer_reviews.title: A nice watch
customer_reviews.text: A nice watch. Looks good. My husband really likes it. The band fits well. The directions were lacking a little but we finally figured out how to set the day and date. It was not hard but the directions could have included this. Other than that, we are pleased with the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Squires

customer_reviews.title: Timex Quality?
customer_reviews.text: I am tried this Timex Watch from two different sources. I could set the date but not the day. I allowed two other people to see if they could set the day and the date without success. I returned the watch because it malfunctioned.
customer_reviews.author: Nightsurfer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: Just like the watch my husband had for years and years. After the watch band and cover broke, he finally decided to get a new watch. He was very excited that it looked exactly like the old one. You can never go wrong with a Timex,
customer_reviews.author: Gilda Weisskopf

customer_reviews.title: The only kind of watch my dad likes.
customer_reviews.text: This was for my dad who’s prior Timex died out. He like the Indiglo and the large number on the face. It was a little more expensive then his prior watch from 6 years ago but he depends on a Timex and won’t use anything else!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan K.

customer_reviews.title: Small wrist band
customer_reviews.text: The watch is easy to read and light weight. However, the wrist band is very small. While it will fit my wrist, the band feels very tight and uncomfortable. If you have large wrists, I would look for a larger band or find a different watch.
customer_reviews.author: neath

customer_reviews.title: Awesome new face
customer_reviews.text: I have for 30 years been buying my husband the same Timex watch .. that lights up and has the white face.. this year for Christmas I went outside the box and bought him a Blue light up face! Rocked his world and he loved it!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Patton

customer_reviews.title: A keeper
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read both day/night. Looks just like the picture. Keeps perfect time. Easy to set once you get the touch. I'm rough on stuff and still looks like new. Good choice. I think it would feel tight on a larger wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Reece Fam

customer_reviews.title: indigo light very poor with blue watch face
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch but when using the indigo light with the blue face makes reading the time very difficult would stick with the white back plate.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Leo

customer_reviews.title: Glad I Bought It
customer_reviews.text: I was on the market looking for a watch until I came across this one. I was skeptical that it would break after a while, but it hasn't and has remained to be in very good condition. The only thing that might be a problem is the fact that one might find themself having to keep adjusting the date. It was annoying at first, but I don't have to anymore. So overall, it's a nice watch, but might seem a bit pricy.
customer_reviews.author: Noor

customer_reviews.title: A classic
customer_reviews.text: My dad has been wearing this watch for years. My mom broke tradition and got him a nicer one with a clasp a few years ago, so when it broke, I decided to get him this for his birthday. He loves it! much prefers its easy to read face and simplicity. He's an older working man that just needs a simpler watch.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Is today Weds. or Thurs?
customer_reviews.text: Its a good watch and for the price its a great watch. My wife often asks, "What day is it?", and I look at my watch and give her the date. "No", she says, "what DAY is it?" A discussion then follows about whether its this day or that day because, well..., it must be Tuesday because Monday nite football was last nite. Problem solved. Now I can look at my watch and say something like, "Its Weds. the 18th". Very cool. Aside from that its good looking, it is easy to read, and with the expansion band its much "dressier" than my expedition model. And, oh yeah, it keeps excellent time.
customer_reviews.author: Dthatch

customer_reviews.title: Loves the watch. Havet. It wasn’t easy to open the packaging. Lost details.
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes the watch very much. He had a difficult time opening the package. There were no instructions. We don’t know about the light. My husband will love it even more. I will go online to find out more about the benefits of the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete
customer_reviews.text: This Timex wrist watch keeps very good time. But there is NO way to adjust the date and day. There are preset numbers in the window, there is no way to change them. Nothing explains how do this. Pulling the stem in or out is useless!
customer_reviews.author: edwin r.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Watch, Worth the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Nice little watch, worth the money. Easy to read dial, as advertised. Almost impossible to set the date, however, but who cares about that. I don't need a watch to tell me what day of the week and month it is.
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Metal watchband that pulls arm-hairs (Shouldnt be sold).
customer_reviews.text: The large, clear readable face is fine. However, the expandable metal band is a pain!! as with another buyers comment. It cuts my arm when I put it on or grabs hairs and pulls them off--Ouch! typical of a Mfg. that doesn't fully test its product before selling it! , I will have to go out after snow melts and find a jeweler (seller) who can replace the band-probably for more than I saved buying it from Amazon. There is another Timex watch available with a different metal band that (apparently) doesn't pull arm hairs, but I'm tired of messing with it. I want to see/feel the thing before I buy it.
customer_reviews.author: GHam

customer_reviews.title: Pay a Little More for Better Quality
customer_reviews.text: My last Timex lasted a very long time so when it went i bought. One of those ten dollar Timex watches at Walmart. Yep maybe lasted ten days! This new Timex is great. I can read the dial and it has worked since the day i bought it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: This is a great watch
customer_reviews.text: This is my third indeglo. The batteries last forever, and I use the gentle glow to light my way on those occasional night trips to the facilities. The watch is designed with a slightly more current and attractive face, the calendar numbers are larger and more usable. The only problem that I have in the past with earlier models of this watch has been that good replacement batteries are very, very hard to find. The good news is that the watch comes with a battery that really does last about 10 years. You will love this watch. I received my in 2 days through Amazon's prime program. Faster than I could have made time to go shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: I guess "they don't make them like they used too" has now trickled down to Timex
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch for my husband for anniversary gift. He had one previously that lasted for years! Not this one, it's been less than 3 months and the band is already broken. By the time I go through the trouble of mailing it for repair and paying for shipping costs, I might as well just get something else. I guess "they don't make them like they used too" has now trickled down to Timex...sad...
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly P.

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an analog watch with an expansion band and day/date feature. Just about as basic as you can get. This watch filled the bill! I'm very pleased with styling and quality, and it keeps time perfectly. The only problem is that the band is just a bit too small for my wrist. It's not uncomfortable, just a bit too tight. I will probably get another band that is adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An enjoyable watch to wear .
customer_reviews.text: A fasionable , nice looking ,easy to read wrist watch . Much to my satisfaction ,I did not even have to adjust the sizing of the watchband . It fits perfectly ,holds fast and does not "pinch" when compressing .
customer_reviews.author: Richard J.

customer_reviews.title: Not a Great Look or Fit
customer_reviews.text: Too small for my 7/10 thick wrists. Like, the band never collapsed fully. Also, watch face was too small. I’m not one for today’s giant SUV men’s watches, but this was a laughable size. Like when my wife said “haha, take that off.” Bummer, too, as I was hoping for a simple inexpensive watch and Indglo is, like, the best.
customer_reviews.author: Deke Shipp

customer_reviews.title: Price is cheap
customer_reviews.text: These Timex itches keep time just as well as expensive brands such as Rolex; the battery lasts for year, and when the battery dies, you can replace it yourself, using the video that you can find on Youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D. Engels

customer_reviews.title: Great for Older eyes
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this watch because he can check the time without turning on the lights and waking himself up. It has large numbers and face so he does't have to search around for glasses either. Go Easy Reader!
customer_reviews.author: dmh1218

customer_reviews.title: All you need to know, nothing you don't.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Very legible 2. 24 hour time if needed 3. Indigo night light 4. Non-buckle wrist band 5. Easy to adjust. No 30 page operator manual needed. Cons: 1. None. Simplest way to set and set time, date and day. If you want more sophistication, go for it. I'll still be on time just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

product_meta.title: Timex Men's Easy Reader Day-Date Expansion Band Watch
feature_bullets: Easy-to-Read White Dial with Full Arabic Numerals
Brushed Gold-Tone Stainless Steel Expansion Band
